comments.body: that's interesting. if it's not `success` it will simple re-run in the `always` section. That should also fail than - only in case there is no aws delay ...
Failures on deletion are always a weird edge case.  What you'll see is that the 'always' clause ignores the error, but ultimately there's not much better we can do.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +15,19 @@    - assert:
        that:
          - output is success
          - output is not changed
